newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland sacks foreign trade minister.
newsitem.headline: Poland sacks foreign trade minister.

text.p: Poland's president on Wednesday dismissed Foreign Trade Minister Jacek Buchacz after official probes showed irregularities in his ministry's handling of the Export Credit Guarantee Fund, a government statement said.
"The motion of the head of cabinet in this matter is linked with a need to guarantee better care over the interests of the state treasury," the statement said.
The statement said the minister's dismissal was "closely bound up with the results of oversight activities" of the Supreme Auditing Chamber and the Cabinet Supervision Office.
It involved "matters engaging the state treasury in ventures connected to export guarantees in which the state and private property were clearly divided."
Buchacz, 48, is a member of the Polish Peasant Party, the smaller partner in the two-party ruling leftist coalition, which is dominated by the ex-communist Democratic Left Alliance (SLD).

A source close to the government said SLD's Prime Minister Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz had surprised the Peasant party with a motion to dismiss Buchacz. The two parties were said to be holding a crisis meeting over the dismissal.
